course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Cultures and Values
course.description: The objectives of the course are for communicative capacity building through humanities knowledge and for enrichment of values and perspectives corresponding to the mission and vision of UST, rather than for enhancement of knowledge in specific branch of humanities. Values explored in this course will be drawn from those closely related to the mission and vision of UST like humanistic concerns of others and the environment, respect of differences and justice, communicative sensitivity, complexity of humanity, potential bias and fallacy in popular perceptions, values, and stereotyping, among others. The humanities disciplinary approaches will be drawn from history, philosophy, literature, anthropology, linguistics and art. The course is offered in separate sections, each has its specific values and approach identified by the teacher.

reviews.author: MS
reviews.title: 英文底好有著數
reviews.comment_content:
Topic: Morality and Emotions in Philosophy, Literature and Film

Workload 重但跟足steps做就好好grade

Lecture 方面
一個哲學course...
情感, 自然, 動物, 科技, 愛情, 審美觀, 民主都有涉獵...
對於理商科既ust人黎講個course係幾另類既...
內容岩唔岩各位就唔知喇...
堂上播過2套電影
一套係宮崎駿既幽靈公主
另一套係王家衛既花樣年華

Tutorial 方面
其實得幾堂
係教寫huma 既essay既 writing workshop
organization, academic style, words, content, apa style都有教
主要係教你點樣去deliver your point in an appropriate academic way
對於寫英文黎講算有幫助...
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture 方面
Prof. 說話速度比較慢, 語調比較單一
可能因為1000-level既course就番d fm人(雖然syllabus講到明建議take左lang1002同lang1003先)
上堂會有問有答, 雖然只限前排既同學

Tutorial 方面
好好彩撞正個好tutor其實 (Derek Wong)
d 口音好British
同埋好有心去講點樣寫好一篇academic writing
有唔明佢都好仔細好有耐性咁講點樣先更加professional同更加coherent
最重要其實要主動問唔好好passive咁坐係度等應機
始終huma1000都係半個英文course想學好英文, 包括writing and speaking都要主動先得
reviews.comment_grading:
Lecture 後期skip得比較多
Tutorial 無skip過
功課交齊
2個Quiz去哂
Video present正正常常
LMES forum唔係regular 出post
Final 果份跟住tutorial比既建議改
最後A range
reviews.comment_workload:
無mid term 無final

Attendance:
d人話上堂PRS答問題係計attendance但我記得唔係...
但Tutorial就一定係take attendance所以盡量唔好走

Readings:
好多份同好多頁
for Quiz同埋final essay做reference
花既時間都幾多...

Tutorial:
要交intro paragraph/ 1個argument/ ws/ final draft/ final essay
其實除左final draft 同essay要比多少少時間做之外其他都好輕鬆

Quiz:
堂上有2個Quiz但佔分細, 放既時間多 (要睇reading同lecture notes, readings都好多下...)

LMES forum:
網上要參與LMES forum (今年開始應該改用canvas?)
大概一個星期一個topic上網打自己既意見
佢syllabus講明要regularly參與
但好多人都最後果一兩個星期先追番哂d topic打意見

Video presentation:
仲有個Video presentation
主要係介紹番你final essay個進度
e.g. 講下你揀邊個essay topic, 你既stance, 你既arguments, 你既supporting evidence, conclusion
3分鐘左右
可以唔洗出樣
upload上youtube
最後要peer evaluation
如果係個tutor班最高分會響最尾果1,2堂係400人既lecture面前 present

reviews.author: Dreamscometrue
reviews.title: No choice
reviews.comment_content:
About humanities, mainly focused on identities: how would you classify yourself (not) belongs to a group. Should have basic knowledge learnt in DSE.

Professor used the historical approach to explain each factor affecting identities. It is extremely boring.

As a business students, I don't know why I need to study this. Perhaps the only use is to fulfill HUMA-SSC.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I didn't attend lectures after midterm.

Lectures: D
Before midterm, what I could learn from him is "Hi...thanks". He wants to keep us quiet but as his content is so boring, no one want to listen to him. It is even more disastrous that his voice is too soft and unclear. Though there may be PRS questions, I skipped all the lessons after midterm. Can't withstand at all.

Tutorial: B
Nigel is a nice tutor, but he sticks to the plan closely. Nothing should be diverted in his session. He is easy going though. In this course, tutors are controlling 50% of your course marks, so they are more important. Follow what he/she wants will be good. If you are in Nigel's class, you are quite lucky. His grading is somewhat lenient. Ask him after workshops if you want detailed comments, usually his comments written on Canvas are short and brief.
reviews.comment_grading:
Only quiz marks are released. I don't know the others. No transparency at all. But I really think Nigel gives high marks.

I would guess a standard to slightly poor grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very heavy.

You have:
Pre workshop materials (easy, just "chok" the answer out)
Online discussion board (suggested to be 200 words per post, but students are submitting a double. I see no point for this)
Quiz (I answered half of the questions by rolling pecils)
Essay draft
Final essay (Prof. Zhang provided prompts which we cannot write argumentative essays. The grading scheme was finally modified)

...to complete. There are many things to complete.

A 3-credit course with 6-credit workload.

One point to note: as you nearly have no choice, reg HUMA1000 sessions NOT taught by Prof. Zhang.

reviews.author: uni
reviews.comment_content: different topics about ethics and morality are disucssed. many examples are given and try to stimulate us to think more from different perspectives and from a wider angle. some topics are quite hard to understand, you may have to look up extra information in internet. you will find your lecture more meaningful if you finish the assigned readings before every lecture. it will help you understand more.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor will ask you to finish the assigned readings every week. Actually there are qutie a lot readings to be finished if you are hard-working. He will only discuss some of them during lesson. There are some video-playings during lesson as well. Maybe try to relax us. also, PRS is sometimes used to get our opinions in different topics, trying to involve us more through discussion.
reviews.comment_grading:
very good.
Actually, the grade of your essay determines your final grade mostly since it counts 50% of your final course grade. So once you do well in your essay-writing and your writing workshop instructor doesn't give you much bad comment, your essay will probably be fine. However, the score of your essay is not released so you can't really calculate your final score of this course.
there are two quizzes, each cost 10%. better prepare for it by finishing the assigned readings and PPT. quizzes are not really difficult.
reviews.comment_workload:
this course has not much workload. You may try to skip the lectures since attendance is not taken. You will gain extra 3% bonus marks for your attendance in this course and professor checks it randomly.
also, the most important thing is your essay. Better prepare bit by bit after your writing workshop. You will find it easier to start and write your long essay, which consists of 1000 words.
there are only 5 writing worshops thoughout 13 weeks and you must attend all of them as all of them would count a percentage of attendance. Try to ask questions about your essay as your instructor will grade your essay.
you have to finish all the online exercises as well. you have infinitive chance to answer those questions. so don't worry about this part. you will easily gain about 10% of final course grade.

reviews.author: 17ow01
reviews.title: Easiest class you could take at UST
reviews.comment_content:
HUMA1000A: Cultures and Values
Honestly this is more like a philosophy class and the content isn't very useful at all as it's mostly BS. If you've taken the IB, this class will remind you a lot of TOK, which was also complete BS. You honestly only take this class to fulfill your Humanities SSC requirement.
reviews.comment_teaching: Honestly the lectures are extremely boring and you really don't have to go to any of them. You can just review the PPTs of the lectures on your own. The writing workshops are much better and somewhat useful for writing the essay. Levi Lam was a great instructor for the writing workshops and was very engaging and funny actually. Don't skip them as they take attendance, which is 10% of your overall grade.
reviews.comment_grading:
50% Essay
20% Quizzes
10% Writing Workshop Attendance
10% Assignments
10% Discussion Posts

You just need to ace your essay. If you do well in the essay and get mean in your quizzes you will definitely get an A. However, if you are trying to get an A+ in this class you better get 1 SD above mean, which isn't impossible but not quite as easy.
reviews.comment_workload:
Theres a final essay, two quizzes, three discussion posts and some very short assignments. The assignments you do them in canvas and you can finish them in less than 15 minutes. They are like 10% of your grade.

You also have three discussion posts evenly spread out during the semester. If you've taken the IB you will have no problem writing them, as they're completely BS anyways but still count for like 10% of your grade.

The quizzes on the other hand are bit more important and count for 20% in total. They're mainly focused on content, which is in the lecture PPTs and some readings which you can do the day before your quiz.

The final essay is the most important aspect and accounts for 50% of your grade. You do have to ace that but honestly its not hard. If you speak English somewhat decently there is no way you can fail this. Hence, the overall workload isn't much at all and you can take it easy in this class.

reviews.author: iKea
reviews.title: HUMA 1000B
reviews.comment_content: The course is focused on different moral values. By this time you should've heard about some of them, so it's not hard to follow.
reviews.comment_teaching: Most of the time Dr. Nam will  make use of some real life examples to make the lesson more enjoyable but given the content of the course, some might found it a bit boring. I'd recommend you to choose the course (HUMA1000 A,B or C) that you are most interested in.
reviews.comment_grading: Quit generous. If you put efforts on your essay and understand what the morel values are about then you should achieve B-range easily.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not difficult but definitely take some time to finish.

You are required to write a 1000 word-ish essay through the semester, which is broken down to different section. The writing workshop would help you to develop you essay well enough so that helped a lot.

Besides the essay there is the online discussion. You are required to participate 3 discussions with your writing workshop groupmates. You receive course marks by having constant constructive conversations with your group so you cannot deadline-fight this.

Oh and there's the online lessons. Basically you'll have to watch some videos before the writing workshop and answer some simple q & a questions with unlimited trials, so that's more like a giveaway  than a quiz lol.

There are quizzes. All are MC questions. Some questions would test if you've attended the lectures or read the extra reading materials. But hey, at least there're just 'some' questions like that ;)

I'd say the workload is acceptable. As long as you follow the schedule and don't leave stuff to do until right before the deadline you should be fine.

3 Canvas Online Discussion - 10%
Online Writing Workshops - 20%
Term Essay (You pick 1 out of 3 topics) - 50%
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Pan is very friendly and passionate in teaching. Always willing to further explain if students have questions or are confused of certain concepts. Though the lecture is very long, she does give breaks and ask interesting questions if lecture is heavy with lots of concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think overall the grading is fine. Good grade or not good grade, I can't say for sure but coming to HKUST via Non-Jupas, I think it's a good grade. You need to put a lot of effort in the essay part. If you follow all the steps by tutor, you should be fine.

I got B+ in the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
As a common core, I think it relatively has higher workload due to the essay drafts you have to submit once every month (almost) and online discussion.

For online discussions, I think it's not that difficult as you can voice out your thoughts and what your stance towards the topic. It's better to cite some sources but really they just want you to express your own ideas.

For essay drafts, it's a step by step approach. So you start off with drafting the thesis statement --> Introduction --> Body Paragraphs (1-2) --> Conclusion --> Final Draft --> Final Essay.

You will also be given readings because you will have to cite some of those readings in your essay. So this could be the one that is contributing to high workload. Otherwise, I think it is fine.

No attendance required or this course.

reviews.author: Sscrew
reviews.comment_content:
I studied HUMA1000B and the content is definitely boring.

At fifteen, I had my mind bent on learning. At thirty, I stood firm. At forty, I had no doubts. At fifty, I knew the Tianming (天命). At sixty, my ear was an obedient organ for the reception of truth. At seventy, I could follow what my heart desired, without transgressing what was right.” This is a self-reflection of Confucius. The improvement throughout his life, not only demonstrates the life of a man of virtue (junzi 君子), but also highlights the dialectical characteristic of Chinese philosophy. This characteristic can be shown by the correlation between righteousness, destiny and well-being.

Lectures and readings will be (mainly) built upon selected texts of Chinese classics. Through studying the texts, students will reflect and explore the deep meanings and relationship between the concepts of righteousness, destiny and well-being, which demonstrate the dialectical characteristic of philosophy of life in both Classical Confucianism and Classical Daoism. For the concept of righteousness, moral conflict between Confucianism and Mohism will be explored, together with the idea of dissolving the distinction between right and wrong in Daoism. For the concept of destiny, the discussion will begin with the ideas of endeavor (li 力) and destiny (ming 命) in the Liezi, followed by possible replies from Mencius, Xunzi and Zhuangzi. As for the concept of well-being, the ultimate goals of the philosophy of life in Confucianism and Daoism will be discussed, and the possibility of obtaining well-being under the influence of destiny will be shown.
reviews.comment_teaching: The Professor was trying to be fun and cringe, and he was quite successful indeed. However the topic itself is too boring, even with jokes mixed, it's still super boring. (Anyways teaching doesn't  matter a lot since I haven't joined any lectures)

1 Two in-class quizzes Multiple choice questions 20%

4 Term essay (including revision efforts) 50%

reviews.author: SharonL
reviews.title: HUMA1000B
reviews.comment_content: Easy and straight forward content. Topics such as Utilitarism, Confucian, and other values were discussed. Moral dilemmas and everyday scenarios are used in class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The courses is divided into lecture and writing workshops.
For the lecture, Professor Nam is quite a funny professor, but with strong Hong Kong English accents.
For the bi-weekly writing workshops, the format is pretty much like a LANG class.
reviews.comment_grading: A range is easy with a decent written essay. Just make sure to attend all writing workshops on time and submit assignments on time. You can always consult the writing workshop tutor for advice on the essay.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is pretty light, just canvas assignments, mid terms and a final essay.
The canvas assignments include exercises to increase essay writing skills, and discussion. There are two mid terms, both MC questions only. For the final essay, there are three topics for you to choose from, and you just have to write around 1000 words.
Attendance is not compulsory for the lectures, but attendance for workshops are compulsory, and cannot be late for more than 15 minutes.

reviews.author: Asia
reviews.title: HUMA1000D
reviews.comment_content:
Culture and values: identity and Community, Contact and Conflict, and Justice and Resolution

Lectures:
It's more like looking back the history from centuries ago, interactions between states and defining different terms like 'state', 'identity' and 'community', etc. with more detailed explanation and examples from the history.
Chapters:
1. Family
2. Villages, Cities, States
3. Ethnicity and Nation
4. Religion
5. Class
6. Trade and Taxation
7. War
8. Rebellion
9. Delivery of Justice
10. Political Mediation

Writing Workshops:
Mainly teaches you how to write a good essay and reviews your essay drafts and idea.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Not sure about the teaching style of the lecturer as I skipped lectures.
Freeman is quite demanding with the essay writing skills and idea. He requires you to have perfect grammar and precise elaboration with an outstanding controlling idea. However, he couldn't explain your mistakes well. It was hard to understand his points sometimes,
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair enough.
The final essay and workshops accounts for 70% of the final grade, which is heavy. It depends on the standard of your instructor. I had a strict one that he had high expectation and requirement.

There are three online discussions (10%) through out the semester. If you want high marks, you must hand in a comment with quantity and quality. Citation is preferred.

There is one quiz which was lecture-related. (20%) Not difficult if you attend lectures. 20 multiple choice questions.

No attendance for lectures.
But workshops take attendance.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much.
Reading the assigned readings is not required, But if you want higher marks in your quiz, they are quite intensive to read.
The essay matters the most. But the workshop will help you finish your essay step by step.

reviews.comment_grading: I typed around~700 words coupled with around 3-4 responses to peers for canvas discussions, aced the final essay, one quiz same as mean and one quiz below mean, ended w an A. So that's actually quite a generous grading.
reviews.comment_workload: Reasonable.

reviews.author: Beckybobo
reviews.title: A good grade course:)
reviews.comment_content:

reviews.comment_teaching:
I didn't attend the lecture at all. Yet, though the experiences of the first few lectures, you may easily feel asleep (maybe is my problem hahaha)
However, for the TA, I would like to give an A to him. He can definitely solve my doubts regardless of the essay.
He would first give you some time to figure out the questions you wanna ask after he has given some suggestions on your draft. Then, he will try his best to explain everything.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite good.
It counts 5 online discussions, a quiz is held almost the end of the semester and the final essay.
You need to attend the tutorial sections as well. The attendance will be counted.
The tutor will help you to improve the quality of the essay and you can feel free to ask him any questions regardless of your essay.
I am not sure whether the course instructor released the marks of the essay. But, I got 18/20 in the quiz which is counted as 20% in the total grade. I attended all the tutorials and completed 4 over 5 of the online discussions (it seems like 2/3 of the discussions will be counted in the final grade). I finally got an A-.
If you know the requirement of the course clearly and do the required follow-up work, you can certainly get a good grade in this course:). You may find it interesting as well.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not that high compared to the other courses at HKUST. You only need to study lecture materials before the exam.
For the essay, no need to worry much about that as the TA and the tutorial sessions would definitely help you in order to have some inspiring ideas.
The examples can be found in the lecture notes easily and you may GOGGLE the related examples too.

reviews.author: lamlamlam
reviews.title: Easy to get B range but hard to attain A range (HUMA 1000B)
reviews.comment_content: I didn't attend 90% of the lectures as the professor told us that lectures are not required in the first lesson. But you have to attend two lectures which involve in-class MC quiz as each quiz takes up 10% of the total grade. It's not difficult if you spend one night before the quiz to study. I didn't spend much time to study the quizzes so my scores are a bit below mean but those MC questions are not that difficult. Ans, you have to attend all the five tutorial lessons and finish all the online tasks which are all MCs on time. Online discussions are also required and you have to write as much as possible if you really want to get good marks for this part. (basically more than 500 words for each topic, total 3 topics). At last, the term essay accounts for 50% of the total grade so it's the most important.
reviews.comment_teaching: My tutor for the tutorial lesson is really nice. Her name is Susana and she's willing to answer all of my questions. As I mentioned, I seldom attended lectures so I don't know how's the teaching of the professor.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Discussions 10% (Me: 6.5/10)
Writing Workshop Online Activities 10% (Me: 10/10)
Quizzes 20% (Me: 15.75/20 Mean:18.1)
Writing Workshop Classroom Activities 10% (Me:10/10)
Final Essay 50% (Me: 41.67/50)
Total 100% (83.92/100)
Final Grade: B+

I think it's fair.
reviews.comment_workload: You have to use concepts learned from lectures and powerpoints to write a short essay to respond to the discussion topic. Also, you have to reply to others' opinions and give constructive opinions back to them. Submitting replies within the last 24 hours before the deadline will suffer from mark deduction, so you have to hand in your work as soon as possible. I think for some discussion topics I wrote over 1000 words, so the workload wasn't that light.

reviews.author: bigJah
reviews.comment_content: The content was intriguing and appropriate for a 1000 level course.
reviews.comment_teaching: I enjoyed the professor's lecture and looked forward to the material.
reviews.comment_grading: At times, the grading was sporadic. I had a difficult time gauging what grade I would earn on a test or project because it always seemed to vary. However, I would still recommend this class to any freshman that are looking to get their feet wet with the course work.
reviews.comment_workload: The homework given out was sparse. Yet, it was extremely important to keep up to date with the syllabus in order to keep track of when assignments were due.

reviews.author: CYH Alex
reviews.title: Huma1000B
reviews.comment_content: Introduction to eastern and western moral theories such as utilitarianism and kantianism. Emphasise on communication skills and logic. A lot of online quizzes and assignments.
reviews.comment_teaching: There were one hour tutorial sections every two weeks and lecture every week. The tutors were very nice and helpful. It is fun in general to attend the lecture and tutorial section.
reviews.comment_grading: Final essay contribute to 50% of the grading, so it pretty much lies down to the final essay. Got B+ Which is okay for a humanity course. There were also attendance for tutorial sections.
reviews.comment_workload: Although there were no exams, there were two quizzes during lecture period. Also tons of online assignments and essay drafts. It is one of the most workloaded course I’ve taken.(life science major)

reviews.author: thethuglife
reviews.title: HUMA 1000 (C)
reviews.comment_content: The course content is very moderate. There are lecture slides and there's a weekly lecture along with a mandatory writing workshop. I took HUMA 1000(C) so it was more on the lines of economic growth and development in Hong Kong from a historic and humanitarian standpoint. The content is all scattered and very descriptive depending on the course title and its contents. Would the content help you learn something practical and constructive? Very unlikely, however it may be interesting for someone simply trying to attain a historical background into Hong Kong and China and how business activities and credit creation were structured.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching in lectures was relatively boring. The lecturer would often speak in Cantonese and even the course content was delivered in an uninteresting manner. The lectures do not have any attendance so most people will prefer to skip them.
While, the writing workshops with mandatory attendance are much more interactive with focus on working on a final essay based on the provided essay prompts. Further, there are segments such as introduction, first paragraph, counter argument, conclusion, etc. which are taught how to structure and write as per university guidelines.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading for this particular course heavily depends on how you perform in the quizzes, mandatory attendance, performance in writing workshop weekly assignments and your final essay. These parameters have different weights but would recommend paying special attention to everything taught in writing workshops.  Personally, I received B+ while I had missed a writing workshop and performed poorly in my second quiz. I would advise you to take the activities during writing workshops seriously.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is relatively low. There were 2 MCQ quizzes (10 marks each) based on lecture slides. Writing workshops have weekly exercises towards making you work on your final essay. There is a final essay which also needs to be submitted, however there is no final. For the quizzes, a simple skimming of the lecture slides is generally enough to perform well. I would also recommend you to go through required docs for reading as several questions are asked from there. Lastly, write your final essay on a prompt for which you are comfortable.

I got an A-. The grading is very good for me. I believe most importantly is a good essay.

Here are the things which count marks.
Attendance for 5 workshops
Online homework
3 online discussions
2 quizzes
1 1000-word essay

reviews.author: Peter_
reviews.title: HUMA1000 L1
reviews.comment_content: The L1 course was fousing on the philosophical perspective, which discussing about the righteousness, destiny and well-being. This course included the lectures and tutorials, where the lecture would take attendence with PRS/iPRS and taught some theories, such as moral theories, while the tutorial would teach you how to write a essay. Before the letures, there were some reading materials to read, and in the letures, there were two quizzes in class. Most importantly was the essay, 50% garding was based on the essay and the three essay topic showed on the first lecture that you can prepare as soon as possible. There was not presentation in the scheme but you can answer the questions during the lecture (it may affect the sub-grade).
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was great and the lecturer was humor and can explain the theories and contents clearly. For example, using the daily example to explain the difficult philosophical theories. However, he put more time on the ethical theories, such as utilitarianism, kantianism, confucianism. mohism (it is enough for you to write an essay), the destiny and well-being are not be talking much. The workshop guided you to write an essay step by step. Generally, the teaching was great and useful.
reviews.comment_grading: Essay weigted 50% in the final score, while the two quizzes in class (one in the middle period and the other in the final lecture) weigted 20%, attented the tutorial workshop (both online and classroom) weigted 20%, the canvas discussion weigted 10%. The grading is fair when you have put an effort in it. Since the essay weigted half of the grade, the language skill should not be to bad.
reviews.comment_workload: There was assigned reading material for you before the lecture, including chinese and english materials. The reading was not an hard workload because the weekly reading only had around 15-30 pages. The online and classroom workshop were easily to finish but you have to particpate the canvas discussion regulary if you want to take the 10% score.

reviews.author: hyhuiaa
reviews.comment_content: Content mostly useless after the quiz (except the chapter related to your essay topic). The in-class quiz covered the content from week 2 - week 7. Lecture videos would be provided for revision purpose. The questions in the quiz covered the content on the slide (ard. 40%), extra content mentioned by the prof during lecture (e.g. name, example; ard. 40%) and reading materials (only concept; ard. 20%). Therefore, watching the lecture videos is the top priority as for the revision, then the slides and lastly the reading materials.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pro. Zhang reli have a good speaking skill & pronunciation. The content of the lecture is very important as the slides only contain a few words and pictures. Do not expect that you are able to understand the slides without listening to him once (i.e. can be through lecture video)
reviews.comment_grading:
16/20 * 20 % - In-Class Quiz (in total 20 question), Mean: 12, S.D.: 2.9
N/A * 10% - Online Discussion (2 comments and one reply should be enough, and have to post at least 2 days before deadline to avoid mark deduction lol)
20/20 * 20% - Workshops + Online assignment (100% attendance & submission is a must because a missing submission/ absence is 2%)
N/A * 50% - Final Essay
- Reli depends on the TA, the comment for the draft is very important as you will know the expectation of the TA and 25% of essay mark is the improvement based on the comment.
- Referring to the concepts from the lectures or reading materials are essential to obtain high grades.
- DSE eng writing lv.4, but the only feedback for the draft is an alignment issue. Final Essay is not about writing beautiful English. It is more like persuading the TA (readers) about your stance with sufficient examples and concepts. Therefore, good English skill is not a must as my friends with 5*/5** in DSE Eng can only obtain A-/A. Logical sense is much more important tbh.

Final Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload tbh.

Spend some time to revise the in-class quiz and proof-read your essay.

online discussion 10%
writing workshop online activities 10%
writing workshop class activities 10% (attendance)
final essay 50%
**attend the lectures may get bonus 3% attendance (IPRS)

quick heavy:
one quiz
four online discussions
four online writing workshops (with tests)
writing workshop once per two week
final essay (1000 words limit)

reviews.author: lsy
reviews.comment_content:
Topic: Cultures and Values: Diversity, Equality, and Resistance

The course covers a wide range of philosophical topics such as Utilitarianism, Taoism, Kantianism, Confucianism etc.

It is not a must to attend lectures as you can look through all the ppts. All tutorials require attendance.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The Prof tried as much as he can to explain the philosophical topics interestingly yet the lectures are still tedious.

The TA is helpful as she can answer most of the questions about how to enhance the quality of the final essay.
reviews.comment_grading:
There is an absolute advantage for students with high English proficiency. The final essay should be written in advanced vocabulary and sentence structures without any grammatical mistakes.

It is suggested to follow the comments of essay draft from TAs to get a better grade.

Averagely, this course has a relatively good grading compared to all the courses offered by hkust.
reviews.comment_workload:
1. Finish online discussion via Canvas time to time
2. Assignments from tutorials for writing the essay
3. A 1000-word final essay with 3 topics to choose from
-It is better to include the theories taught in lectures
4. One mid-term in MC questions

reviews.author: bigbigapple
reviews.title: HUMA 1000
reviews.comment_content:
有好多唔同contents
religious, country, states, ethnicity 等等social belongings的東東
如果上堂專心的話應該幾有趣

tutorial會教你作final essay， take attendance

ppt得圖無字，無得溫ppt，上堂要抄notes，quiz好多上堂野
不過應該係得依個professor係咁
唔聽書都得，超多material
final essay有3條你揀，我揀左quiz前課題，所以quiz後堂全走
reviews.comment_grading: 幾好grade，跟住tutor guide line 作final essay 唔會差得去邊，英文好當然更著數
reviews.comment_workload:
有4次online discussion，要求deadline前兩日做好，否則扣分
長短視乎你tutorial咩風氣，有d成千字，有d300字都okay
得一次quiz 同一篇final essay

reviews.author: Ruby Wong
reviews.title: HUMA 1000 theme: Cultural anthropology
reviews.comment_content:
Different theme for different semester
please refer to the email
For me, the topic is Cultural Anthropology
Sex and marriage
Rebillion and disorder

Power and influence

reviews.author: Elo
reviews.title: Elementary
reviews.comment_content:
Culture & Values
About relations between individuals, families and societies, explain with philosophies (not many). Lectures are easy, but reading materials are a little bit difficult to comprehend.
reviews.comment_teaching: He demanded all students to keep quiet in lectures. He may ask questions, but not many would answer anyway. Just keep quiet, don't let him call out to you for chatting.
reviews.comment_grading:
A simple 20Q quiz
Attendance taking for both lectures and tutorials. Better attend all tutorials in this case.
The most important part is the essay, which composes 50% of the final grade. If you attend all lectures, you would have already finished at least 40% of your essay before deadline. However, there's very little help provided by the tutors. Since they have to take care of all students in so many classes, they don't really pay enough attention to you. They just tell you to write, give very general comments, and let you be. Better work hard on your own, try to ask others for opinions if you want to get a good grade for your essay.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light. There're lecture videos so you don't have to attend classes (if you don't care about attendance). And you would have finished nearly half of your essay before deadline. So no worries. Quiz is based on lectures. He showed mainly pictures with very few words so you may need to watch lecture videos for details.

reviews.author: Cherry Kua
reviews.comment_content:
Topic: Cultures and Values: Diversity, Equality, and Resistance
Canvas online discussion(peer exchanges) 10%
Workshops(Online content 10% &
classroom sessions 10%)
Quiz (lectures & assigned readings) 20%
Essay (1000 words) 50%
Writing workshop is more important than lecture
reviews.comment_teaching:
his lesson is pretty good but sometimes boring.  the lecture is pretty easy-going
However, I don't have any idea for the writing workshops
reviews.comment_grading:
you have to do all his assignments
Only quiz marks are released. I don't know the others. No transparency at all.
reviews.comment_workload:
it doesn't have a really heavy workload
The assigned readings are quite useful for the final essay.

reviews.author: JChan
reviews.comment_content: The Course is quite good. The course is quite similar to Liberal Studies for HKDSE students. If you are very interested to News and Liberal Studies , i strongly recommend you to apply this course.This course discuss lots of news and cases from Hong Kong to the whole world.  Also, the course's quiz is easy, as the quiz only have 20 MC questions and do it in a lecture room without any seats arrangement . Although i got 19/20 in the quiz, the tutor did not like me much and i got only a C range.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is quite good for the tutors and it is so similar to Lang lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: I got C range grading. I think is quite important for getting a nice impression for the tutor in the tutorial session. Since the impression for the tutor really affects your grading much.
reviews.comment_workload: This course has tones of workload and the homework are usually writing paragraphs or research, but mostly the prior one. Although the course has heavy workload , the homework are usually easy as you can research through surfing internet.

reviews.author: lone traveller
reviews.comment_content: It covered quite a number of moral theories like utilitarianism in the lectures. you just need to understand the theories and apply some in your essay. Then you are good. As for the tutorials, they are just the extension of Lang 1003 to guide you to write an academic essay.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nam Sai Lok is quite a nice and decent lecturer who is trying to make your life easier by minimizing your workload. He showed videos like matrix and saving private ryan in the class and included current affairs which were closely related to us as teaching material. Quite a brilliant way to express theories which are vague in a simple and attractive manner.
reviews.comment_grading:
As I have mentioned above, he is here to help you. As long as you follow the rules of the game, finish all the quizzes which have unlimited attempts, do the online discussions, attend all the tutorial sessions and produce a decent essay. It cannot be too bad.
I followed the rules and finally got an A
reviews.comment_workload: The heaviest workload has to be the essay itself. But no worries, as long as you follow the path of the tutorial sessions which you will be required to write one part of the essay. By the end, you just join them into one complete essay like building lego. Do it step by step and you will be safe. As for the close book quiz, just remember to have a look at the ppt beforehand, then you can nail most of it easily.

reviews.author: Kabul
reviews.title: The most recommended section of all. (Now HUMA1000B)
reviews.comment_content:
一開始聽人講係用中文教孔孟之道仲以為伏味甚濃，畢竟中學嗰科垃圾中文科已經受夠。但係嗰陣 year 1 冇乜嘢好 reg，跟住見到其他 topic 都 wait-list 百幾，結果都係死死氣 reg 咗入嚟。

讀讀下又發現幾唔錯下。👍

一開始會教中西唔同嘅道德哲學思想，包括 Utilitarianism, Kantianism, Confucianism, Mohism 等等，到到後期會涉獵到孟子同埋道家對 "Destiny" 嘅睇法，個內容係有 D 虛嘅。

至於好唔好玩就見仁見智喇，我個人覺得幾好玩同埋學到唔少嘢。至少解答咗我 UST admission interview 嗰個 trolley problem，嗰陣時我仲諗緊條問題做乜鳩...

🔶 Utility in Utilitarianism
🔶 Categorical Imperative in Kantianism
🔶 Filial Piety and Uprightness in Confucianism
🔶 Universal Love and Impartiality in Mohism
🔷 Dissolving Moral Conflict in the Thought of Daoism
🔷 Tian （天） and Ming （命）
🔷 Righteousness and Destiny in the Thought of Mencius
🔷 Self-establishment and Detachment of Zhuangzi

Only topics marked with 🔶 appeared on the quiz.

同埋個 tutorial 幫到我之後 spring sem LANG1003 篇 argumentative essay。因為個 tutorial 係會 guide 住你由 introduction, argument, counter-argument 到到 conclusion 逐 part 講點樣寫篇好嘅 argumentative essay，比起 LANG1003 講得更仔細，兼且畀埋篇 A+ 嘅 sample 參考，有篇嘢跟住模仿係好好多。

BTW reg 科儘量 reg 個有空位嘅 tutorial，個 SISPROD 見到前面 wait-list 嘅人 match 唔到 tutorial 佢會畀你打尖 reg 入去。
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr Nam 一口 typical 港式英文好得意好 cute，不過勝在個人比較 kind，上堂氣氛都幾 chill 下，有時會搞下爛 gag 咁（不過又真係好爛下）。佢時不時會用 iPRS 問下你對某 D 具爭議性話題嘅睇法，亦都會鼓勵上堂積極問問題同埋表達意見，個人都幾開通幾 open-minded...

至於 Nigel 個 tutorial 就真係悶到瞓晒覺，佢做嘢好跟 step 同埋 planning，同埋份人太嚴肅，不過都算 nice 同埋肯答問題。同埋我覺得佢畀 grade 唔錯。
reviews.comment_grading:
💻 10% Writing Workshop Online Activities
🏫 10% Writing Workshop Classroom Activities
✏️ 50% Final Essay
💻 10% Online Discussion
✏️ 20% Quiz

Grading 真係好睇 tutor 同埋你好唔好彩。

成個 course 最重要嘅就係篇 1000 字嘅 essay，一定要落足心機寫同埋跟足 tutor 指示改。

個 quiz 都幾緊要，果陣得個 quiz 得廿題佔成個 course 20%，1 題 MC 1% course grade...唔好唔溫書...

💯 我自覺自己篇文麻麻但係最後都竟然有 A。

不過我一個 friend tutor 係 Susanna 結果慘被 kill 到得番 B-。BTW 我 DSE 英文得 5，作文都係得 5；但係我個 frd 英文 5*，作文 5**。所以靚唔靚 grade 真係好講彩數。

加上畀 grade 透明度極低，唔出 final essay 個大分，令到自己個 grade 更加難好預計。
reviews.comment_workload:
💻 去 tutorial 之前要上 Canvas 睇 online materials 同埋做 exercise，所以要 keep 住做。

💻 仲有 online discussion topic，要定期 check 住 Canvas 個 discussion group 發表意見，果陣一個二個 D comment 都寫到好似八股文咁長，所以我真係唔敢 hea 住做。

✏️ 另外就係最重要嘅 essay，first draft 真祈唔好 hea 做，因為個 tutor 會就住你篇 first draft 比意見，而呢 D 意見對篇 final essay 十分之重要。同埋千祈唔好做 deadline fighter，我果陣就係臨尾先開工，做要撞埋 LANG 篇 writing 同一日交，結果 chur 死我。

reviews.author: Ellen.L
reviews.comment_content:
It is quite boring at all. I do not enjoy having this class.
The content is about the culture of different group of people.
reviews.comment_teaching: I do not like the lecturer but I think the tutor is quite helpful and easy-going. Susana would offer useful suggestions.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think it is fine for year2 students or above.
The final essay basically equal to your grade unless you get very low mark in quizzes.
The quiz is not difficult if you finish all the readings and powerpoint.
reviews.comment_workload: 1 final essay and two quiz

reviews.author: Priscillia Wong
reviews.title: very chill course
reviews.comment_content:
Learned about several ethical theories and philosophies such as Utilitarianism, Kantianism, Confucianism etc... There's lecture note + assigned reading provided for every lecture. (However, the midterm exam was based on the lecture ppt so reading the assigned readings wasn't necessary for us.)

This course has 1 lecture per week + 1 writing workshop every other week that is dedicated to the written final essay.

For the assignments, there's a few online discussions(graded) + quizzes on canvas before every workshop + final essay.
reviews.comment_teaching: Poor teaching skills + broken english. However, he at least tried to be funny and make the lectures interesting. (even though it didn't work....)
reviews.comment_grading: Not difficult to get a good grade as long as you understand the theories and apply them in the final essay since the essay is 50% of the overall grade.  The online discussions and quizzes were pretty easy and straight forward.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload since I gave up on reading the assigned reading after the first 2 lectures. But the assigned readings are quite useful for the final essay.

reviews.author: wasd0109
reviews.title: Relatively easy to handle
reviews.comment_content: The content is related mostly to social phenomenon. It may not sound easy at first but some of the topics covered did inspired me in certain aspect of life and is pretty enlightening. Although lecture is not necessary but it is quite fun.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good with example explaining some of the theory that could sound difficult to comprehend. The instructors are engaging and are willing to answer student's question on both the contents and the assignment with some good advises. The instructor even setup a session after the lecture for questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
B for me, it may not be the best grade but it's acceptable for an unfamiliar common core.
Grading is based on participation of writing workshop, end term essay, quizzes during lecture and some online discussions.
reviews.comment_workload: The end term essay is guided through workshop step by step so the workload is divided into weeks. The quizzes aren't too difficult but may require some time for reading through the materials. The online discussion maybe a little bit time consuming as it  require personal pov and ask for support and references, but overall I think it is quite light.

reviews.author: lokenken
reviews.comment_content: There is only on lesson per week, and attendance is required. There will be iprs questions each lesson for attendance. However the teaching material is not too interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not allowed to use laptop during class, personally I think the teaching could be more clear and straight forward.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite good.
reviews.comment_workload: Light. There are only 2 quizes with 20 MCs, as long as you finished reading the ppts and assigned reading, you will be fine. However, there are 5 online discussions throughout the semester, do not do it near the deadline or else there may be mark deducton.

reviews.author: Edisonycp
reviews.title: Review for HUMA 1000 L1
reviews.comment_content:
About different Chinese and Western philosophies such as Confucianism and Utilitarianism. Ethics and theories are discussed to understand the originality, culture and history of human beings.

Details about content:
Confucianism- Filial Piety (Xiao)
Mohism
Utilitarianism- Overall happiness
Kantianism

Writing structures of an argumentative essay will be taught in compulsory workshops (tutorials)

With several referred readings provided for reference
Not difficult to understand and to apply on final essay
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture:

The instructor is a funny person which elaborates ideas through personal experience and jokes while his English is too poor and it's hard to understand. In a sense, it's quite annoying and causes disturbance.
Teach by ppt
However people always find it boring because of these philosophical topics and the overall attendance in the hall is around 50 percent

Tutorials:

Discussion is required during tutorials
Tutor is quite nice who teaches much better than the instuctor. Of course, with a much better fluency amd usage of English. Moreover, notes and worksheets will be delivered in tutorials to engage the class. The learning atmophere is much serious in an around 10 person workshop. Students are able to ask and answers questions, furthermore discussions allows us to exchange ideas which is extremely crucial for the final essay.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good comparing to most common core courses
Fluent English and higher level of English writing skills is important in this course
Mean is about B- to B
Personal:
Quiz: Mean
Canvas: All completed
Essay: Slightly above Mean
Final grade:B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy
Have regular exercises on canvas which provides unlimited attempts
Exercises must be completed in order to have higher grading
Also PRS is used to take attendance

reviews.author: Jesslyn
reviews.comment_content:
He covers these main topics:
-utilitarianism
-confucianism
-mohism
-kantianism

and some other small topics where are not included in the quizzes/ assignments
reviews.comment_teaching:
-pretty boring lectures (I skipped almost all and read the lecture readings on my own)
-ATTEND all tutorials since attendance is taken and it's the best time to consult your instructor regarding your essay)
reviews.comment_grading: your essay is the main constituent of your whole grade so better work on it well. And do not disregard your quizzes tooo since they are easy to score.
reviews.comment_workload:
-1000 words essay by the end of the course (thoroughly reviewed by your instructor so it's an advantage)
-2 quizzes (/10 each, mcqs, looks easy but is quite tricky)
-online assignments to be completed (graded based on submission NOT scores, thus you can redo the quizzes several times)
-lots of reading

reviews.author: Teresa16
reviews.comment_content: most of them are common sense, for the Chinese philosophy it's a drag from high school for Chinese people, and a huge confusion for the others. To that, get a Chinese friend to help you with it
reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring to read, but easy for studying.
The lecturer speaks monotone, and is kinda annoying that is tempting to quit lectures(which I had)
We print the ppt, and it's cool
But it's still better to keep track of the lessons, cuz some quiz questions comes from what he said in class( no matter how casually he said it, which is a drag)
He can be bargained for the level of difficulty of the quiz though, which is quite nice. Boring, but nice
reviews.comment_grading:
Essays are for Those with good English
Follow the sample and it's easy to get an A,
There are short quizzes, but they are easy enough if you looked at the ppt, you'll pass
reviews.comment_workload: Following discussion forums are a real pain, and do pay attention to the online hw, while the essay needs to be written by the week

reviews.author: s101003
reviews.comment_content:
每堂lecture教一個moral theory e.g. Utilitarianism, Kantianism, Confucianism。 本身對此類課題興趣不大，因此個人認為課堂比較沉悶。

Tutorial不會重複lecture內容，主要是教導一些寫作技巧為final essay作準備，跟英文課類近。
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor上課會用不同例子解釋moral theory，講解尚算清晰但節奏偏慢頗沉悶。有耐心，人很好，quiz以及有關final essay的安排會先徵詢學生意見。

負責tutorial的Ms. Susanna Ho也很好人，很照顧每一位學生，針對drafted essay給的意見對final essay很有幫助。
reviews.comment_grading:
Assessment主要分為以下幾部分:

1) Class participation
- 上課偶爾會有iPRS
- 在lecture中發言會有bonus

2) Tutorial
- attendance
- online workshops (unlimited attempt)
- assignments (e.g. response to essay prompt, introductory paragraph, one body paragraph)

3) Online Discussion x4
- 共有四次online discussion
- 就每次discussion topic發表意見，回應同學發言會較高分

4) MC Quiz (20題)
本來有2個，各佔10%，因為颱風取消了一個，剩下一個佔20%
問題普遍簡單，上課沒聽講丶沒看readings也沒關係，只需考前讀熟lecture ppt就會答

5) Final Essay
- 佔50%
- ~1000字
- 需在文章中運用堂上所學的moral theory至少兩次

grading不錯
online discussion每次臨deadline前提交約二三百字，沒有回應任何發言；final essay只在其中一段提及一個moral theory；quiz 18/20；做齊online workshop；沒缺席；grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
workload不大

online workshop一般可在五分鐘內完成

tutorial隔週一堂，因此每次assignment均有約兩星期時間準備，每次寫約兩三百字

quiz內容算少，考前一天只需花數小時就能讀完lecture ppt

reviews.author: Vincent Wan
reviews.comment_content:
Topic:Cultures and Values: Diversity, Equality, and Resistance
Canvas online discussion(peer exchanges) 10%

classroom sessions 10%)

Tutor nice and funny
Comments he given in the last tutorial was useful to modify our final essay and ensure that what we write is what he wants
reviews.comment_grading: A range if you follow all guidelines and ask questions to tutors and lecturer about the final essay. Revise half hour before the quiz is enough, common sense and straight forward questions
reviews.comment_workload: workload is quite heavy but i can handle it

reviews.author: Ruby Chen
reviews.comment_content: The content involves anthropology and concepts about cultures.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is very nice and approachable and is willing to provide help to essay.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was okay, remember to attend the writing workshops and follow all the deadlines. Be sure to put enough effort into writing the 1000 word essay, should be fine if the structure and the logic of the essay is clear.
reviews.comment_workload: Although there is no final exams, there are still 2 quizzes, 1 final essay, and online discussion to participate. I suggest one spend some time every week writing a decent online discussion.

reviews.author: skhoaa
reviews.comment_content:
Topic:Cultures and Values: Diversity, Equality, and Resistance
Canvas online discussion(peer exchanges) 10%
Workshops(Online content 10% &
classroom sessions 10%)
Quiz (lectures & assigned readings) 20%
Essay (1000 words) 50%
Writing workshop is more important than lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching: Listen to the opinion from tutor of the writing workshop. Persus also provides a lot of help to the final essay in the optional tutorial. About half idea of the essay is from him. He provide a lot of good points to the essay.
reviews.comment_grading: A range if you follow all guidelines and ask questions to tutors and lecturer about the final essay. Revise half hour before the quiz is enough, common sense and straight forward questions.

Very low workload
