5 discussion in total, need to write about 200 words each, suggest to give at least one feedback to other student.

reviews.author: winghaysam
reviews.comment_content: only talks about the traditional thoughts of China
reviews.comment_teaching: Only because of the IPRS would take the attendance, otherwise there is no need to go to the lecture, as the ppt will be uploaded to canvas and you do not need to listen what the professor talked in lesson
reviews.comment_grading: actually if you attend all the tutorial lesson, IPRS, do all the assignments in canvas and hand in a fair essay, you can get a B range
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too big, all the assignments in canvas are easy and you only have to hand in a 1000-word essay

reviews.author: ccchanai
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course can actually be interesting just that you have to be personally a big fan of abstract thinking. Course materials covers a wide range of topics ranging from Happiness VS Pleasure to the evil human instants.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In the tutorial, Mr. Levi LAM's teaching definitely deserves an A, while personally, i'm giving an E to Prof. CHONG, Kim Chong for that I didn't hear no English from him in lecture. Maybe it's my problem.

The supports on the essay from Mr. Levi LAM is very helpful all the way from the clear and easy-to-follow instruction he gave at the first place to his tailor made advice on you work.
reviews.comment_grading: Your grade is affected mainly by the Final Essay (50%), for which you have 3 topic to choose from, while I chose Pleasure VS Happiness. Your grade also depends on the essay progress presentation (in form of a video), one selected post you wrote in the online forum, PRS (both in-class little questions and the two "Quizzes") and tutorial attendance and participation. I got very positive feedback on the first draft of the essay and I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
The only good thing is that there were no midterm and no final.

For the essay, it does cost some time and effort due to its length (1000 words).

For the online forum, I only wrote one post, and submitted that as my chosen post. Secured an A.

For the tutorial, as long as you attend all 5 sessions (2 hours each though) and respond to your tutor, you'll get a nice score.

For the lectures, I don't always attend them physically but I still got an A. The only time I studied the lecture notes were to look for sth I can quote in my essay.

Readings? Didn't touch them at all. You can find enough references online for your essay.

Just find your own way to complete all the PRS in-class questions. As for the 2 "quizzes", revision is barely helpful as the questions were just made to make you not get it correct. So, don't be too serious about them!

reviews.author: ckyyy03116
reviews.comment_content: 其實內容有d悶 係講西方同中國唔同思想嗰d例如Utilitarianism and Confucianism
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Nam 講野幾好笑不過關於教學內容就有d悶
教授好在尊重同學意見 e.g. 比我地投票決定make-up quiz係幾時考、內容包括邊個ch.
reviews.comment_grading: 整體唔錯, 最後個grade係common core黎講算幾好, 主要都係寫好篇essay因為essay佔好重, 其次係2個quizzes
reviews.comment_workload: 要寫1000字essay, 3個online discussion, 隔個星期要上workshop

reviews.author: akwong
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture:
will have ppt uploaded to Canvas
extra examples will be given for u to be used in your final essay

Tutorial:
Content simple and short
though not that useful but cannot skip
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tutor nice and funny
Comments he given in the last tutorial was useful to modify our final essay and ensure that what we write is what he wants
reviews.comment_grading:
no marks could be checked
dunno the marks for online discussion and final essay
good grade though
reviews.comment_workload:
Depends whether u will work hard or not
coz no marks can be checked so dunno whether the effort in online discussion paid off or not
5 times of online discussions and 2 quizzes with 20 MC
1 final 1000-word essay
some online exercises

reviews.author: BPiggy
reviews.comment_content: The content about utilitarianism was indeed fun, but the other 3 types of moral thinking was boring and was hard to understand because the content materials were quite vague.
reviews.comment_teaching: Fun in general, the professor often make scenarios which are worth thinking. The movie ( Saving Private Ryan ) watched in the lecture was attracting but was hard to find the connection with teaching materials.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading come with good writing skills and attendence.
reviews.comment_workload: In the whole term, the workload came from the workshop followed with the Huma 1000 course but was not overwhelming. The 1000 words essay was also not difficult compared to the one from Lang 1002. The online discussions made the students communicate with each other more frequently.

reviews.author: ransacker69
reviews.title: Good course to boost your GPA
reviews.comment_content: Decent content, easily comprehensible but at times boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: The content is self explanatory and doesn't really require much teaching to understand. Regardless, the instructor does a good job explaining the various scenarios.
reviews.comment_grading: Easy to score if you're regular with your work. Final essay carries 50% of the grade and an A range is not hard to obtain.
reviews.comment_workload: There are online assignments and discussion topics to be completed regularly which I didn't find to be interesting. Also, tutorials/writing workshop has points for attendance and there's homework for that too. The workload is sizeable for sure, but it's not difficult.

reviews.author: Radln
reviews.comment_content: Easy to follow. An introduction of moral philosophy, including Kantianism, utilitarianism and other Chinese philosophy.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good. Dr Nam is a good teacher, such as he used relevant clips or movies to illustrate the abstract part of the philosophy.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading system mainly depends on the essay. I got the marks around mean in two quizzes. A bit passive attitude in the discussion forum. But my tutor said my essay is quite good then my final grade is A-.
reviews.comment_workload: Two quizzes ,one essay, attendance and three times of discussion forum. Twice-a-week tutorial for the essay, which means you can write a paragraph for each workshop and finish the essay with ease in the end.

reviews.author: ycw
reviews.comment_content:
Topic about moral ethics e.g. Utilitarianism, Confucianism.
The content is quite boring.
There are several writing workshops that have to be attended which helps on the final essay.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is fair. Professor tried to make the content more interesting but lessons were still boring.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair, consist of a final essay, MC quiz, some online exercises, discussion and attendance for the writing workshops.
reviews.comment_workload:
No mid term and final exam, only have one MC quiz.
A 1000 words final essay, a few writing workshops homework and online exercises which is very easy.

reviews.author: Jamky
reviews.title: Good grade but dull lesson
reviews.comment_content: Not a practical lesson but interesting to those who love philosophy
reviews.comment_teaching: Dull lesson and sleepy
reviews.comment_grading: I got an A- as my final grade, but it doesn't mean that this instructor is great as the final grade is given by your tutorial instructor instead of the lecturer.
reviews.comment_workload:
Comparatively speaking, the workload is average.
A total of 2 quizzes and 5 online discussion are taken into account for assessing your grading.
Attendance is optional as it is only counted as bonus point to your grading but not compulsory.
However, the most important factor contributing to your final grade is the performance of your FINAL ESSAY. The fact is that even with a high score in quizzes, a poor FINAL ESSAY really affects your grade finally.

reviews.author: Thyy
reviews.title: Recommended if you are lazy and confident with your English level
reviews.comment_content: The course is divided into two parts, lecturing and writing workshops. You listen and learn different moral ethics during lectures, for example utilitarianism, kantianism, mohism and so on. You then apply what you have learnt in your final essay, which you will learn how exactly should you write it in the five writing workshops that you are required to attend. Overall it is a course that teaches you both essay writing techniques and traditional moral ethics, which is quite useful as it is an eye opener and essay writing skills are essential in university life.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is acceptable, the professor who delivered the lectures had terrible English so it was quite a struggle to listen. The professor who taught me in the writing workshop was quite helpful and friendly so generally it was nice.
reviews.comment_grading: If you are confident with your English standard, this is the course for you as the final grade is vastly affected by your final essay, which is a huge advantage for students with somewhat high English proficiency. Excluding this it is still a course which you can rather easily have good grades because a lot of marks are given to you for free as long as you finish all the assignments.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is comparatively little as the lectures are optional and so you can actually only attend the five writing workshops for the whole semester. There is also little homework throughout the course. However the final essay does need a bit of time and effort.

reviews.author: HH
reviews.title: Culture and Values
reviews.comment_content: Content is interesting. Course explores culture - specifically, values of diversity, equality, and resistance. Topics explored are: sex and marriage, religion, food, inequality, gender relations, ritual, religion, rebellion.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor was hard to understand and follow at times and made the interesting concepts/topics boring - rambled through most of the lecture. Workshop teachers are very helpful though - they thoroughly assist and advice you in the writing of your essay which is the main bulk of the grade.
reviews.comment_grading:
In class quiz: 20%
Online discussion posts: 10%
Workshop tasks: 10%
Workshop attendance: 10%
Essay: 50%
reviews.comment_workload: Long readings per week, but other than that only 2 quizzes and one essay. Not a lot of workload and easy to handle.

reviews.author: Joannawong
reviews.comment_content: Only covers 4 main moral theories and the last 1/3 lectures can be not attended as they are out of syllabus. It's quite boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Nam speaks chinglish which is hard to understand and his pace of teaching is slow and plain. Yet the teaching of the TA is practical and useful comments are given.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy workload. Every two weeks there will be assigned online works and be awarded not to miss any of it. Once you handed in everything on time, a good grade is deserves.

reviews.author: cmt
reviews.comment_content:
Utilitarianism, Kantianism, Confucianism, Mohism, Destiny
大致上係咁
似係用英文讀翻中文，英文唔多好嘅人其實聽書可能會有少少辛苦。
reviews.comment_teaching:
教授得閑會講下笑，上堂氣氛算係幾好。
而且佢每一堂都會叫學生發表一下意見，發表意見可以加分，聽聞會影響一個sub grade
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading 方面佢有guideline比你跟
本人覺得grading 方面算係ok
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload大，要做好多野。
Online assignments(無限次比你試，可以全部滿分。每個星期都有，要check住canvas睇deadline）
Online discussion(有4-5個，每次點都發表一次意見就最好，亦都要check住canvas睇deadline）
Workshop(計attendance,所以最好全部都去。每次workshop之後都有assignment, e.g. 畫mindmap，寫introduction paragrph, 寫body paragraph. 啲assignment有做而且唔離譜佢就會比滿分.Workshop就係教你點寫篇final essay)
2 quizzes(因為天氣關係，我只係考左一個quiz。全mc，簡單，大部份題目照powerpoint 抄， 有啲題目佢會問翻佢上堂講左啲咩，所以無去上堂理應就唔識答。不過依啲題目佔好少）
final essay( 佢一開始就會話比你聽有咩題目你可以做，有幾個月時間比你諗。佔50%)
雖然workload大，但接近一半course分你可以全部攞足，如果你肯跟的話。

reviews.author: yhngao
reviews.title: those with weaker english proficiency are not recommended to take this course
reviews.comment_content:
rich content about different cultural topics

powerpoints with a lot of examples but quite boring

*tips: if you want to enroll into huma1000 successfully, choose a tutorial with the least wait-list
reviews.comment_teaching:
i didnt attend all lectures and i find the lectures not interactive and responsive as it seems the prof is teaching all the time

tutorial: also boring and i dont think it really helps much in my essay writing
reviews.comment_grading:
i got below mean and mean for my two in class quizzes respectively

i have done all the online activities on canvas (both classroom and online) and scored full mark

for online peer discussion, i submitted one essay and one response in each discussion, i am not sure about the marks or results

the mark for the 1000-word essay is not revealed, i think the grade is quite good
i think most people score b range or above
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is heavy, not quite

two close book in class quizzes (all MCs) you could score high marks if you read all assigned readings and revise all powerpoints

online activities: watching videos and answer questions (before each tutorials)

online peer discussion: 5 discussion topics and much to write (essay and response)

1000 word essay: preparation during tutorials, drafts submission are required

no final exam

tutorials: attendance taking required
lectures: attendance taking serves as bonus marks

reviews.author: Juice_1
reviews.title: Reasonable time/effort-> your grade
reviews.comment_content: Philosophical concepts including morality and ethics are discussed. Utilitarianism, Kantiansim, Confucianism,  Mohism, Daoism, concept of Destiny, and different ideologies of Confucianists are introduced.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Did not attend class as there are not much content for quiz, few lectures I attended were not that interesting.
The teaching of tutorial was comparatively interesting, featuring how to communicate one's idea effectively through writing. Moreover, the feedback of the tutorial was very helpful for the final essay, though lectures are not essential to attend, tutorials were very useful. (no attendance in lecture but tutorial)
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading seems to be proportional to the time and effort that is put in to the course.
Essay 50%
Online discussion 10%
Online material 10%
PRS Quiz (In class) 20%
Tutorial attendance 10%

Other than Quiz and Essay, very easy to get full marks (not sure about the online discussion as grades are not given at the end)
Quiz: can be studied before a week, even in a few days by going through all the PPT
Essay: need to use concepts that are from the lecture and PPT, needs good english

A+ seems to be hard to get
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload
Essay isn't that long to write, and gives plenty of time to revise and write.

reviews.author: Twinky Leung
reviews.comment_content: It's meaningless for students to study culture, resistance and religion. I cannot find the core values after I studied this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof. NEVER upload the ppt before the lectures. You have to pay attention in the class. She likes to walking around and ask us questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade. I think if you finished all the online quiz, in class quiz and attend all the lectures, you can get B+ or above.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is huge since there were lots of online quizzes. And you have to read all the assigned readings in order to get a high marks in the in class quiz as well.

reviews.author: Hollie
reviews.title: good grade
reviews.comment_content: as mentioned in the course name, it basically tells the cultures and values in various countries, but most of the time professor would use the US as an example to demonstrate the difference between the east and the west. The content is not difficult to handle and it is more like a talk show, you can learn with ease.
reviews.comment_teaching: Interesting professor from Taiwan. Open and funny. Not boring as she talks about different stories and sometimes jokes a bit. PRS is taken for 3 lessons randomly. Even though you skip the lectures, you can still read the ppt and catch up on your own without much problem. PPT is uploaded to Canvas after each lecture. BTW, professor doesn't quite like the students using computers or phones during lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade. Seems like most people are able to get a satisfactory grade. Unless you can huge problem with English, you will be able to handle the lesson quite well.
reviews.comment_workload: Weekly quiz on Canvas, but you can repeat the quizzes as many times as you want in order to get full marks. One essay. No exam, only mid-term with mc. To be honest, even if you have not gone through the required reading materials, you can still get good grade, anyway, those readings are not demanding, few pages.

reviews.author: ddd
reviews.title: get ready to suffer
reviews.comment_content: Western and Chinese philosophy
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr Nam is the worst professor I have ever met in my life. You simply cannot understand what he's saying and if you understand, it's too boring to stay focused. The only reason to go to class was iPRS.

However, the TA - Eugene Li was very helpful. He explains how to write your essay well and gives you a good feedback.
reviews.comment_grading: got mean for quizzes and completed almost all online workshop activities, I don't know how was my essay but at the end managed to get A-
reviews.comment_workload: Depends on your attitude. If you do all the readings, it's probably quite a bit, but later it's easier to write the essay. I didn't do any readings and barely went to few classes, so it took me some time to work on the essay.

reviews.author: Fishie
reviews.title: Generous grading, bs content
reviews.comment_content: complete bs, basically common sense stuffs such as gender equality and culture stuffs. Some topics are interesting-- but your final essay content could be completely irrelevant to the stuffs you learn in lectures, because tutorial classes teaches you how to write a proper essay instead of reviewing lecture notes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures- E. The professor does not know how to teach. It was already stated in the first class that lectures are optional, however there would be 3% of IPRS quiz.

Tutorials- C. It is a good review of essay writing, however it is rather simple because you basically learn primary stuffs such as thesis statement etc. You are encouraged to write a 5 paragraph essay and the tutor is rather picky on your organisation rather than the content.
reviews.comment_grading:
Writing workshop online activities 10.0%
Writing workshop class activities 10.0%
Online discussions (peer exchanges) 10.0%
In-class quizzes 20.0%
Final Term Essay 50.0%
reviews.comment_workload: 5 canvas discussion topics, some MC online quizzes, 1000 word final essay. Not difficult, but quite some stuffs to do.

reviews.author: Slimshady
reviews.comment_content:
The content is fundamental but it's still more than enough as a 1000-level course. It teaches about Kantianism, confucianism, daosim, etc.

Only first half of the course content is assesses in the quiz.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The accent of Prof. Nam is quite disgusting I would say lol. Regardless of that, he's a good professor who is willing to answer your enquiries after lectures and possess a certain sense of humour. He often use analytical questions to arouse discussions in lecture, through which I think is the most effective part of the course that let me understand those philosophical concept.

p.s you have no idea who's your tutor for tutorial. My tutor was Sue Chang from language center, which I found is totally useless for both the course and my life.

p.p.s. attendance for tutorial is compulsory, so hope you get a good tutor. Luckily, there's only 5 tutorials in one semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got full marks for attendance and online workshops, which is a must and it counts for 20%

quiz: 16/20, above mean 1 s.d. (20%)
online discussion: grade not released (10%)
final term essay: grade not released (50%)

Final grading: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is the lightest I've ever encountered in UST.
50% count for the final essay (1000 words)
and 20% count for 2 quizzes (we only have 1 as there's a typhoon XD)
the other 30% is the attendance, online workshops and discussions which you can easily score full marks if you complete them all.

reviews.author: ssho
reviews.title: 藍世樂的 huma1000
reviews.comment_content: 教的東西整體都容易明白的 只是中國哲學較難了解得深入
reviews.comment_teaching: Sai lok 的英文是很特別的 大家有機會好好感受一下 :0) 我有english native speaker 的朋友也聽不懂他在說什麼
reviews.comment_grading: 我覺得Grade很好 救了我的gpa  利申a range
reviews.comment_workload:
只有1篇1000字essay 1個quiz （20 條mc) 沒finals 但有3個online discussion 我每個覆了一兩次啦
Attendence 是隨機抽來計的 答問題也有分加

reviews.author: M_1240
reviews.comment_content: content contained general ideas about religion, gender and other aspects of society.
reviews.comment_teaching: The classes aren't as exciting as they should be
reviews.comment_grading: two quizzes and bonus on attendance in the lectures. The essay counts for 50% and the rest of it is around 10% each including online work and in class work
reviews.comment_workload: The tutorials are a lot more important, since they discuss your essay and ideas. They are compulsory attendance classes. The online work material is fairly easy and can be completed on time. The in class work is almost always finished in class and very little is asked to be completed later.

reviews.author: Ashfaaq
reviews.comment_content: Interesting content as you get to watch some movies (In my case, the life of Pi) - Then you have to write a report. Content is easy to follow.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lectures were quite long and you have to attend mandatory tutorials as well so it takes significant time. Lectures are fun but tutorials can be extremely boring.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is extremely fair. I wrote my report and was told to fix certain content in my report however due to my workload, decided to submit the work without any changes. Received a B regardless so I it is quite fair
reviews.comment_workload: Quite a bit of workload

reviews.author: Grant
reviews.title: Easier Elective to take
reviews.comment_content: A little boring but an easy elective. Highly recommend taking this class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pretty average class. Pay attention and you'll be fine. Teaching style is nothing incredibly different from other professors at HKUST
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fair. The essay portion of the class fulfills most of the grade. If you put the work in, this will be an easy class to get an A in.
reviews.comment_workload: Manageable. If you plan your time right, this class will be very easy for you. It's a nice class to take alongside more technical core classes.

reviews.author: Avocado
reviews.title: Interesting enough.
reviews.comment_content: The section I took was about linguistics and languages. The main reason I took this section was because it sounded really interesting, and the lecture content itself was pretty interesting (although very, very theory based and you have to remember every little detail for the quizzes).
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was alright, but it is a class of 400 students so you can imagine that most students aren't paying attention to the professor. I approached her once regarding my essay structure, and she was very helpful and suggested some improvements regarding my points etc. My writing workshop instructor was Prof. Siu, and he was very nice and helped me on my essay.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is alright. There are two in-class quizzes (I got below mean for one and 1 SD above mean for the other), as well as multiple online workshop activities (easy to get 100% as you can retake the quizzes as many times as you want).

There's also one essay paper (around 1000 words) that you have to write, based on one of the three/four essay prompts they give you. As long as your English is good and you can make coherent and logical arguments with reference to the course content, it should be easy to get a good mark.

Attendance is taken 3 times during the semester (randomly) through PRS.

In the end, I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: There are required readings before each class (do these, because they are tested in the quizzes), as well as online activities before each workshop (not too much). Most of the workload comes from the essay - if you want a good grade, you need to put in some effort.

reviews.author: bun jai
reviews.comment_content: 內容有埋西方同東方哲學，例如 孔子孟子之類。其實唔洗多睇，最緊要係英文能力，year one 學生建議唔好reg，除非writing 勁。重頭戲係一篇essay，應用堂上嘅知識就ok
reviews.comment_teaching:
lecture 係講翻d 哲學嘅內容，幾乎每堂都有PRS，呢個prof都幾好笑，但係就英文麻麻地。
tutorial 係20人一班，分成幾個group一起討論essay嘅內容，個tutor會逐個逐個黎傾題目
reviews.comment_grading:
聽說好grade，但係好grade係for英文屈機嗰d人。
我應該炒左份essay，最後b-左
有兩個quizes 都係靠背嘢，好似佔20％，所以唔好偷懶！
reviews.comment_workload: workload 唔大，大多數homework都係canvas度做，個discussion 就煩d嘅，要係canvas度打，呢d分數影響唔大，應該大家都咁上下，final essay 先重要。成個sem嘅tutorial 都係圍繞住點寫篇essay

reviews.author: karenchengckll
reviews.title: HUMA1000
reviews.comment_content: Things taught in lessons is very inspiring. Many reading articles are recommended and they are all good to read. The course led you to think more about human beings.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lectures are boring and power point is not reader friendly. Self studying will be better.
reviews.comment_grading: Mostly weighted on the final essay which depends a lot on your English composition ability. There are PRS during lessons and will be counted as attendance. Quizes will be very much related to the powerpoint.
reviews.comment_workload: Many compulsory work and fixed time frame for assignment. But the deadline helps spread your workload across the semester.

reviews.author: KM
reviews.comment_content: my topic is about happiness
reviews.comment_teaching: The topic is quite interesting but the lesson is quite boring
reviews.comment_grading:
good grade
I think many can get A range in my lecture
10% online discussion
10% writing workshop online activities
20% in-class quizzes
10% writing workshop class activities
50% final term essay
reviews.comment_workload:
light workload
there is no mid terms or final exam but only 2 in-class quizzes
online discussion and online tasks are easy to get full mark
the main task is writing essay, but if you can do it well then you can get good grade

reviews.author: Vikram
reviews.title: Take for grade
reviews.comment_content: It doesn't matter which lecture you choose - the content for all sessions would be quite boring for most people. This is a good course for its grade and medium workload, nothing much else. However, if you take the tutorials seriously enough, your English writing ability will improve slightly.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professors aren't very passionate. Lectures can be incredibly boring - nobody listens to anything. Tutorials are more interactive, and can help you write a better essay for submission.
reviews.comment_grading:
As long as you:
-put reasonable effort into your draft essay
-listen to the feedback given to you on your draft essay
-don't screw up the quizzes badly
-answer PDS (you can do your own thing in lectures)
You are almost guaranteed A+
reviews.comment_workload: Tutorials are biweekly, you can sleep in lectures, and you only have to write one essay in the entire course. The quizzes shouldn't take long to revise for (1-2 hours each).

reviews.author: wahahapurewater
reviews.comment_content: If you love Greek/Chinese philosophy, then this course will benefit you a lot. My lecture (L3) covers both East and West values on social participation, family practises and self realisation. It can be quite boring sometimes when professor teaches about theories and showing videos/movies film in the 1960s Lol...
reviews.comment_teaching: Well my mainland professor's english pronunciation is quite strange and her tone is weird. She sounds like a robot. Before ending each lesson, she will pick one or two students to answer her question or raising questions, tho students seldom respond. Most of the students attend the lecture because of PRS, totally ignoring the professor's teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is super good. Essay is extremely important as it counts for half of the grade. Follow all the guidelines given and modify it according to your tutor's advice, this will lead you to a good grade. There will be two quizzes which are all in the format of MC. It's easy if you study so the mean is gonna be high.
reviews.comment_workload: Little revision is needed. But indeed you have to pay much effort in writing the final essay. Participating in online discussions are needed, which is quite irritating and annoying to be honest.

reviews.author: Grave
reviews.comment_content:
there is quite lot of content but none are important coz you wont memorize them
have fun n 9 write the essay
reviews.comment_teaching: oh i did attend the lecture, but i didnt listen at all, its fking boring :)
reviews.comment_grading: its goood, i didnt do much of the discussion and the essay is totally mess, i dont even know what i am writing about and i still got a C+.
reviews.comment_workload:
one essay and 2 quizzes and many discussion.
the essay i cant help you, coz i barely understand the topic.
as for the quizzes, dont study unless you damn hard preparing it, the questions it ask are dumb and  very detail, btw u can use own common sense to answer it.
discussion-----screw it

reviews.author: Chauchau628
reviews.comment_content: There were three topics including Chinese philosophy, social issues etc. Personally saying, social issues was the easiest topic for your essay.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lectures are optional but tutorials are really important as it counts the attendance heavily. The instructor of tutorial was nice and caring who gave lots of useful advice in how to write a clear thesis statement and topic sentences.
reviews.comment_grading: Your grade will depend on essay, attendance of tutorials, online discussion and 2 quizzes. But overall the grading is reasonable.
reviews.comment_workload: An entire course with one essay and online discussions.

reviews.author: cheung53
reviews.title: Huma1000
reviews.comment_content:
Chinese and Western Values
Destiny...
reviews.comment_teaching: Not clear
reviews.comment_grading:
If you can write well and quoting what you have learnt correctly,  above mean in the quizzes, make comment in online discussion, getting an A is easy.

The essay question is like this.
1.Would you travel back in time to kill your roommate in the above circumstances? Provide a sound argument to support your decision using what you have learned on this course

2.Suppose that, in the future, technology exists which makes any kind of transplant possible and that the transplants are legal and affordable for all, do you think that the situation described in the film The Island is morally permissible? Using what you have learned on this course, present an argument to support your stance on this question.

3. If your mother and your wife fall into the sea at the same time and you are only allowed to save one of them, who will you save?(sth like this)
reviews.comment_workload:
A lot of reading materials
2 in-class quizzes
1 essay
The workload is not heavy.

reviews.author: hi auntie
reviews.comment_content:
Topic: Utilitarianism, Confucianism, Destiny and principle of happiness.
It is quite interesting and thought-provoking. It requires you to make decision from different perspectives. Every question has no fixed answers. You only need to answer them logically by using some school of thoughts he has taught before.
If you don't mind reading and understanding the traditional Chinese and Western philosophies in English. It would be an interesting course for you.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr Nam's English is not easy for listening but I would say it is satisfactory. Sometimes, you may find difficulties in understanding some theories from his English, especially for Mencius and Confucianism. Therefore, you may need to review his powerpoint afterwards or beforehand so that you can catch up.
In the tutorial section, my tutor is Lee Pui. He is very familiar with different theories taught in the lecture and he can figure out your mistakes and logical problems immediately in the essay. Actually, I think attend the tutorial is more important than lecture since it all cares about your final essay and guide you how to write it.
reviews.comment_grading:
I finally get an A in this course in year 1.
I suggest year 1 students to take this course because if you are not well performed in this course, its weighting would be halved. Attendance is required for tutorial section.
There are two quizzes in this course and one final essay. If you are above mean 1-2 marks in the two quizzes and your essay is approved and refined according to your tutor. It is quite sure that you would get A range in this course. If you really want to get good grade, you can send your essay to Dr. Nam or your tutor for some suggestions and proof-reading.
reviews.comment_workload:
Slight heavy workload. There are discussion in canvas, two quizzes, one final essay and some homework depend on your tutor. No mid-term and final exam.
Some foreign students may write an "essay" in the discussion section but I only write 150-250 words per response. I think discussion is not about the length but most importantly, it is the number of response and the strength of points that matters.
Two quizzes (all MCQ) requires you to understand and memorise the reading materials provided. You should at least briefly read through the reading materials one time. There will be two tricky questions requires you to answer Dr. Nam's thought. If you have not attended the lecture, you can only guess.
Final essay is easy to finish since the tutorial requires to to complete it step by step, from introduction to conclusion. Every two weeks you need to hand in one part of you final essay and the tutor will check your progress in every tutorial. If you can follow the progress, you have no need to rush for the final essay at the end of the semester.

reviews.author: tisb1234
reviews.comment_content: The content in my semester was very boring and weird. I often had to search on internet to understand it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor only read the powerpoint during the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
There were 2 mc quizzes and 1 essay needed to hand in. 2 mc quizzes were quite difficult as I was needed to understand concepts and points delivered by the lecture.

The essay was more important than the quizzes, so as long as you put effort on writing a good essay, you can still get a relatively good grade even you failed those quizzes
reviews.comment_workload: One essay although took some time. So you better prepare writing one before the deadline.

reviews.author: Wilson J

reviews.comment_grading: Not quite good
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload (2 small quizzes and 1 essay)

reviews.author: Jon

reviews.comment_grading: Based on your English writing skills only. Attendance also factors a part of your grade, and so do in class quizzes with the PRS system.

But the essay was far more important than those quizzes, so as long as you put effort on writing a good essay, you can still get a relatively good grade even you failed those quizzes.
reviews.comment_workload: Only 1 essay needed to be handed in and also some simple exercises needed to be done in ust connect every two weeks.

reviews.comment_grading: Good grading.
reviews.comment_workload: Not a lot of workload. Just 2 quizzes and one essay and done!!

reviews.author: trvsw
reviews.comment_content: Content isn't bad if you don't just hate reading. It's not easy, but variable stuffs are thinkable; it's not a big deal to complete all the graded materials.

reviews.author: Thomas

reviews.comment_grading:

reviews.comment_workload:

The supplementary readings only related to the quiz, it makes no sense reading all of them every week.
No workload at all.

reviews.title: grade算好
reviews.comment_content:
L1:  Language, Communication, and Society

This course will mainly talk about the topic of language, like how can we acquire a new language or is there a language exist in other species.

Remember to choose L1,L2,L3 carefully because they have different topic and you may find it boring if u dont choose it wisely.
reviews.comment_teaching:

reviews.comment_grading:

Writing Workshop Online Activites 10.0%(watch video online and do the task)

reviews.author: kickerofass
reviews.title: Great course with extremely good grading
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite boring. Some people may claim some topics and lectures are the 'traps'. However, I think the course has a uniform grading system among all topics. There were three lecture sections and you can randomly choose one (or just the one that you like the most). It does not affect the final grade at all. Course content is fair but a bit boring.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The class is conducted in LT and there are over 200 students in a class. There is no need to answer any questions in class. Of course, you can skip all classes except on the quiz days. There were two quizzes (10% of the whole course) throughout the semester. Make sure you are present on those days.
For the tutorials, you MUST be present every time. It counts towards the tutorial performance (20% of the whole course). Remember to answer as many questions as you can, especially at the beginning of the course. As your tutor is rumored to be the one who marks your final essay, fighting for a better impression could bring you a little advantage.
The MOST IMPORTANT point: Before handing in the final essay, you are required to do your first draft and submit it to the tutor. DO IT SERIOUSLY so that you can ask for very valuable advice from your tutor. After you receive the feedback, you MUST correct your draft ACCORDING to the tutor's advice. That can guarantee a good mark for your final essay (50% of the whole course).
reviews.comment_grading:
Extremely good grading!
All you have to do is to write the essay and ask for as many advice as you can!
In class quizzes - 10%
Forum discussion - 10%
Video presentation - 10% (seems to be cut from the syllabus now)
Writing workshop performance - 20%
Final Essay - 50%
Actually I think the marks of workshop performance and final essay are interrelated :)
I got A finally with two quizzes above mean, 8 forum discussion (each at least 300 words) and a first draft with a good feedback.
FYI, syllabus is attached.
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely low workload. Just an essay and attend all workshops.
For the quizzes, I just went through the notes one day before the quiz days. No need to recite anything as all are MCs.

reviews.author: Gracia

Lectures tend to be boring.
reviews.comment_teaching:

She tried to interact with student and involve students by using PRS.
5 minutes break,usually after the 1st hour of lecture
reviews.comment_grading:
Can't really know the scores of essay and discussion.
1000 words essay (50%)
2 quizzes(2 x 10%)
Canvas online discussion(10%) - around 5 topic
Online task (10%)

Choose 1 out of 3 different essay prompt relating to the course topic,and develop it to 900-1100 words long essay.

reviews.author: heeeeeee
reviews.comment_content:
stuff like individualism, family in 80s, utopia
take this course for fulfilling the school requirement only.
reviews.comment_teaching:
i never listen to the professor because i am not interested in the topic discussed, I was doing revision on other courses/hea throughout the whole semester.
But looks like the professor tried to engage the class, but it's difficult for a big class (3XX people), and she welcomed questions and asked if we had any suggestions after quiz 1.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% online discussion
10% writing workshop attendance
10% writing workshop online quiz/hw
20% quiz
50% essay
3% (bonus) lecture attendance

I scored 16/20 in both quiz which is 1 SD above mean for the 1st quiz and median for the 2nd quiz; full marks in writing workshop and online activities (everyone get full marks), unknown score for online discussion and final essay, however I was very hea in doing the online discussion (attempted all but the quality was around average).
--> Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
For weekly lecture, you can skip all, you can read notes urself.
For online discussion, just make sure you post your 1st comment at least 3 days before the deadline, and you must reply other's comment at least once, you can complete it very hea, just make sure you give your stance (the sample TA gave was F***ing formal, just ignore that).
For writing workshop (50min per section, 5 in total for the whole sem), should attend all, 2% each for just showing up (*5=10%), quite useful as you can discuss your essay with ur peers working on the same topic, and your instructor.
For quiz, 20 MCQ each, ~80% came from lecture notes, i never read any required readings, and never listen to professor in lecture, scored 16/20 for both quizzes.
For the essay, the hint is to follow the structure of the sample essay they provided to you, you should also make some reference from journal (from proquest), this makes ur paper looks more professional (+ more effort), just around 5 reference is enough.

If you follow the schedule, then workload is actually extremely low, and the grade is good.

reviews.author: wongmandy

reviews.author: Achilis
reviews.title: (L2) -- Righteousness, Destiny and Well-being
reviews.comment_content:
This section of HUMA1000 will Introduce different ethic concepts. Western and traditional Chinese concepts like Utilitarianism, Kantianism, Confucianism and Mohism.
The main point of HUMA1000 will be the tutorial section which you should not miss anyone of them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is not really good at speaking English in my thought, so there will be difficulties understanding the contents of the course (at least for me~).
Moreover, most of the topics mentioned are so boring that one will easily fall asleep if he is lack of good quality sleeping or not concentrate enough. Fortunately, the lectures are basically useless since you can refer to the teaching notes and have self-study by yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online discussions (peer exchanges) 10%
In class quizzes 20%
Writing workshop class activities 10%
Writing workshop online activities 10%
Final term essay 50%
Total 100%

You are supposed to get full marks in the online assessment (which is actually all MCs with unlimited attempt trial).

Besides, as long as you attended all the tutorial classes, you will get full score for the  workshop activity part.

In class quizzes is a bit challenging as some of the answers while some of them require you to have knowledge on the assigned readings.

If you have time, you can write more on the discussion in order to get a higher score and try to reply others' opinions so as to have some interaction, but for me, I am quite lazy as I only commented for once for each topic and even didn't really reply to others.

For the essay...you may find some friends who are good at English to help you proofread it in order to eliminate all the careless mistake. Bear in mind that it is vital to ask for Tutor's comments during the tutorial section such that your essay can fulfil their requirements

FYR, I scored 14/20 for both quizzes and eventually got A- for final grading,which is fair enough to me.
reviews.comment_workload: One of the easiest courses so far with only little workload and no final exam, especially now we don't have to hand in the video concerning about the essay progress.

reviews.author: Meg
reviews.comment_content: Easy course. Good to take if you have a stressful semester and want to balance it off. The tutorials and lectures are completely different. The workshops are called writing workshops that basically teach you what your final essay should include and how it should be written.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is fairly good. Material is easy so not much to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. 2 in lecture quizes (20%)
2. One final essay (50%)
3. The rest includes tutorial attendance, participation and all the online work.
reviews.comment_workload:
1. Online discussions about once a week
2. Online quizes (Unlimited tries)
3. 2 in lecture quizes
4. One final essay

Tutorials happen every alternate week (so about 5 a semester). You need to attend each and every tutorial or you loose marks.

reviews.author: Yaka
reviews.title: Morality and Emotions in Philosophy, Literature and Film
reviews.comment_content:
It is the only SSC-H course, which means that it is compulsory.

The theme and content of the course is different for different lecture. As you are required to spend a whole semester on one essay title, it is suggested that to choose the topic that interests you, or you are familiar with.

Remember to attend all the writing workshop.
reviews.comment_teaching:
My lecture and writing workshop instructor for that semester are Shengqing Wu and Ellen Yik. Both of them are good enough as they give clear instructions on what the course expects and how to achieve those expectations.

Prof Wu played some movie clips to raise our attention, and have interaction with students.

Ellen is willing to respond to questions and the atmosphere of the class is casual.
reviews.comment_grading:
Stick to the requirements in the given marking scheme. Always remember to finish all the tasks on time. Be aware of the structure of your essay and also the usage of language. It is very important to develop your  idea deeply with appropriate citation. DO what the feedback ask you to do.

If your English is not so good, you may ask help from the others for the grammar checking of your essay. The essay counts half of the grade. Take it seriously and you will get reward.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quizzes in class, one essay that have an instructor guiding you to finish, at most two reading materials each week. No exam.

Compare to some other courses, the workload is light and once you handed in your essay, you don't have to prepare for a final anymore.

With many students leaving the LT after taking the PRS attendance and most left remaining silent, it was really embarrassing. The tutorials, called "Writing Workshop", had little to do with the lecture, but mostly taught how to write the final essay.

reviews.comment_workload: Assigned reading for every week, which does not necessarily need to be completed. The peer discussion and the final essay make most of the workload.

reviews.author: jennifertj
reviews.comment_content:
L1: Each section of the course has different main theme to be covered. Here are the areas of topic being discussed:

1. Pleasure, Happiness, and the 'Good Life'
2. The Meaning of Life
3. Self-Interest
4. Moral Conflict
5. Cultural Relativism
6. Utilitarianism
7. Are there absolute moral rules?

The topics explained through powerpoint presentations by the professors and individual assigned reading will then be used to write a term essay with the following titles:

1. Analyze the possible meanings of the “good life.” State your own conception of the good life and why you think it is good.

2. Would you agree that all human actions are ultimately motivated by self-interest? Provide reasons for your agreement/disagreement.

3. On page 18 of The Elements of Moral Philosophy (Ch.2), James and Stuart Rachels provide the following argument against Cultural Relativism: “In some societies, people believe the earth is flat. In other societies, such as our own, people believe that the earth is spherical. Does it follow, from the mere fact that people disagree, that there is no ‘objective truth’ in geography? …Similarly, there is no reason to think that if there is moral truth everyone must know it. The Cultural Differences Argument tries to derive a substantive conclusion about a subject from the mere fact that people disagree. But this is impossible.” How conclusive is this argument against Cultural Relativism? In what sense may Cultural Relativism be valid?
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Chong has a really soft and monotone voice. He also does not have much engagement with the students, thus making the overall lectures to be quite boring and easy to fell asleep. The topics being taught by the Professors in class would mostly be based on the assigned readings given.

(Note: Better to read the assigned readings before hand to allow you to follow the lectures easily)
reviews.comment_grading:
*good grading as long as you do well in your essay

Term Essay (50%)

insert most of the materials you have learnt in the lectures to the essay, 25 out of 100 percent of the score was taken from how well you respond to the feedback of the draft essay

In-Class Quiz (20%)

Two multiple choice quizzes based on the powerpoint presentations & assigned readings

Online Activities (20%)

1. Unlimited attempts of online quizzes which should be done before the writing workshops
2. Participate in the online discussion

Attendance (10%)

Random iPRS attendance taken during lectures
(Note: all writing workshops take attendance)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for the whole term was okay. The 50% term essay could be done manageably through the guidance of the writing workshops. The online activities would not be much a problem too since you have unlimited attempts to attained a perfect mark. The only concern would be the amount of assigned readings that you should manage to read every week, which then be useful for the in-class quizzes and to write the term essay.

reviews.author: trish
reviews.comment_content: For L2, it is mainly about Utilitarianism, Kantianism, Daozi, Tian Ming etc., which I found them abstract. There are one powerpoint, some reading materials and key point notes for each lecture.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr Nam has relatively poor English. It is easy to fall asleep during the lectures with his monotone. I almost fell asleep every lecture. Overall quite boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade!
I did not pay attention in the lectures. I just read the powerpoints and notes before the quizzes. My first quiz was 9/20 (below mean) and the 2nd quiz was 13/20 (above mean).
Attendance to the lectures is counted as a bonus.
The writing workshops guide you to write the final essay and you just need to follow the examples.
It turned out that I got an A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is light.
You need to do several online quizzes every alternate week with unlimited attempts so you can score full percentage for this part.
There is a writing workshop every alternate week. Simple tasks should be done before the workshop. Since there are some examples, it is not hard to follow.
A 1000-word final essay is needed.

reviews.author: Keel
reviews.comment_content: I did the L3 course in fall semester and the content of the course is about how western and Chinese philosophers view the idea of "self". It is obviously an interesting debate but, you probably don't need to know everything from the course for the ultimate essay.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of the lecturer is to be quite frank, boring.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading considering I didn't even complete most of the quizzes on time and I still have a reasonable grade. Of course,
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is heavier than most UST courses. You have to complete about one quiz per week and there are readings which are, you know, "compulsory" for you to read.

reviews.author: WWF
reviews.title: Elementary introduction to some philosophiical concepts
reviews.comment_content: Materials are all very accessible on canvas in preparation for the 2 quizzes and 1000 word essay of the course. Basic concepts such as Utilitarianism and Kantian ethics as well as abstract concepts like the good life are covered. In general, a very standard humanities course that is compulsory to all students.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor lets you out an hour early for each lecture so it is quite chilled, but he is retiring after this semester so this section doesn't matter.
reviews.comment_grading: Essay is the most essential component, not much statistical information are released by this professor (no essay component marks nor quiz grades). Quite a few people got an A-range in my tutorial session, so the grading is not bad at all if you could write an effective and persuasive essay. Other components includes the online class activities which makes up about 20% of your grade, Quiz that makes up 20% and 10% for tutorial participation. There is also a 3% bonus for attendance, but I don't think it really matters.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is extremely appropriate for the course. Usually one or two assigned reading per week, if you are interested in the topics it won't take too long to finish reading and understanding them. Tutorials are bi-weekly and mandatory, the instructor predominantly goes through the concepts learned from the online tutorials.

reviews.author: pchu
reviews.comment_content: Just another writing assignment. Not much to learn really, the topic of the essay is quite boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very casual, nice instructor if you pay attention.  Sometimes boring.
reviews.comment_grading: Grades are not bad if you revise ur essay according to the instructors comments and pay attention in tutorials. Easy to get a good grade if u hv a stronger english foundation.
reviews.comment_workload: If ur lucky you get a instructor tht doesnt check hr hwk rafh tutorial, else theres a simple task every werk you need to do. Not difficult but annoying.

reviews.author: hs
reviews.comment_content:
Content:
-Pleasure, happiness, the "Good Life"
-Meaning of life
-Self-interest
-Moral conflict
-Cultural relativism
-Utilitarianism
-Kantian ethics

Format:
Weekly lectures where the professor reads off the slides verbatim. Assigned weekly readings, but nobody really reads them until preparing for the quiz. Weekly tutorial "workshops" where the TA helps you prepare for the final essay (common sense tips about writing essays). Two quizzes on readings/lectures.

Assignments:
-Unlimited-retries online activities that should be an easy full score
-Online discussion about some topic discussed in class (i.e. post your thoughts and reply to others)
-Draft & final essay

Attendance:
-Random PRS polls the professor uses to record attendance during lectures
-Tutorial workshops take attendance
reviews.comment_teaching:
-Professor just reads the slides verbatim: boring, but easy to follow
-Workshops are a waste of time: content covered could be summarized in a pdf that would take 2 minutes to read
reviews.comment_grading: This course should be an easy grade as long as you aren't asleep. The online activities give you unlimited retries, so that section should be an easy 100%. The essay grading is pretty lenient as well.­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­
reviews.comment_workload: The online activities don't require much effort, and you have almost an entire month to work on the essay. The biggest part of the workload is probably the weekly readings, which nobody reads anyways until the day before the quiz.

reviews.author: Sally
reviews.comment_content: Some ideas of ancient Chinese philosopher: Confucius, Mencius, zhuangzi, laozi... Western moral theories: kantism...interesting ethical Deliemma.
reviews.comment_teaching: Easy to follow and workload was moderate.
reviews.comment_grading: Relatively fair.50%essay,20%participation of writing workshops,10%online discussion, 20% 2 quizzes. The essay was important, since it took up half of the grades. However, the requirement for grammar and article writing was not too strict because it is a common core course that is offered for all university students including year one.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload was fine, although online discussion and writing workshops must be paid careful attention to every two weeks. It's not hard to get most of the mark if you follow the instruction of TA and the workshops intructors.

reviews.author: Tomy
reviews.comment_content: About Chinese philosophy and part of western philosophy. The content is quite related to daily life and not very hard to understand as a local student.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Nam is a very good prof. who always jokes in his lessons. Yet, he has a not very good accent. Non-local students may find it difficult to understand at some point. Overall speaking, His teaching is very good for locals but not for non-locals.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is quite good compared to other lectures in the same semester.  Dr. Nam once mentioned that he won't give any F as long as students are handing in an essay with logical things in it.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is fair. Just some bi-weekly online workshop that are quite easy but time consuming.
Two not too difficult quizzes and a final essay.

reviews.author: ym
reviews.title: Happiness
reviews.comment_content: Talk a lot of psychological theory, If you are interested in these kind of stuffs. It would be a good choice to you.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very boring, very very boring. I feel sleepy every lectures. Tutor 1hour per 2 week. Tutor taught you how to write the essay.
reviews.comment_grading: very subjective, grade depends a lot on your essay. You should choose the right topic to write your essay, otherwise difficult to get a good grade. At least, My friends and me choose the same topic and get a bad grade.
reviews.comment_workload: not much, only essay and 2 quiz. online workload about 15 min per week

reviews.author: chingyan
reviews.comment_content: my topic is about linguistics.
reviews.comment_teaching: the instructor in the lecture is quite dull, her accent kinda weird, but the in the tutorials is quite fun and friendly, he provides lots of useful and practical information
reviews.comment_grading: it's not difficult to get a good grade if you attend all tutorials and show willingness to improve your essays. listen carefully what your instructor in the tutorials says because that really helps.
reviews.comment_workload: no heavy workload, and as the tutorials would update your process, it's not so difficult to hand the essay in on time.

reviews.author: Eclipse
reviews.comment_content: Interesting stuff if you are into philosophical ideologies. Lecture covered contents such as Kantian Ethics, Utilitarianism and etc. The writing workshop provides notes and tips into writing the final essay that you have to submit.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecturer was pretty boring and his voice projection was not clear enough, so much so that people in the back half of the lecture theater could not hear him. Most of the people that do choose to turn up to class usually do whatever they wish to do.
The writing workshop is a little more informative, with only 10 people to a session. This helps the instructor have more attention towards each student and allows for a comprehensive teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
I would say it gives pretty decent grade. About 30% of the grade comes from small activities, such as classroom participation (mainly in the writing workshop tutorials), online discussions and online quizzes, which allow the students to try over and over again until they get full marks.
There is in-class quizzes, but so long as you do study the content of the power point slides, there should not be a problem scoring well.
The essay grading seems pretty lenient - follow the template given in the writing workshop notes and you wouldn't go terribly wrong.
reviews.comment_workload: There is a decent workload for this course, such as biweekly online quizzes and discussions, 2 in-class quizzes and other bunch of stuff that you have to complete.

reviews.author: lindsay
reviews.title: 幾好 grade
reviews.comment_content: Utilitarianism, Kant,etc. 對哲學有興趣既話睇 suggested reading 都幾有趣,不過上堂就悶悶地
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor 鐘意講爛 gag 同埋英文麻麻
reviews.comment_grading: 幾好 grade, 不過 quiz 幾難.
reviews.comment_workload: quiz 會考上堂講到既嘢,所以想 quiz 攞高分要聽書, 至於 suggested reading 可以唔睇,不過都幫到寫 essay 搵 point 同 reference. 無左拍片之後 workload 少左

reviews.author: King416
reviews.comment_content: 每個sem嘅野都唔同，而每個lecture亦都唔同，但咁多個lecture嘅workload都差唔多。我個人認為有啲空泛，難明，但差唔多必修咁滯，冇計，照讀
reviews.comment_grading: 有兩個test，全mc，啲題目會問下上堂講嘅example、例子，專心聽書都尚可應付
reviews.comment_workload: 唔算太忙，每個星期做少少野，所以篇essay唔算做得辛苦

reviews.author: 1_chris
reviews.title: 英文好既就應該冇乜難度!
reviews.comment_content: Topic圍繞住Happiness, Self-interest, and Morality黎講, 我自己覺得幾有趣既, 不過身邊既朋友就覺得好悶; L1 L2 L3 都係揀自己有少少興趣既黎上啦, 如果唔係就會上得幾辛苦 (有PRS) Haha
reviews.comment_teaching: 呢位新加坡黎o既Prof.講野好細聲, 同埋個Tone令人好易訓著.. 不過睇得出佢都幾有心教既, 同埋教埋今年就退休, 所以之後科大o既同學都唔會比佢教, Teaching呢Part既分數可以無視 :)
reviews.comment_grading:
1. In-class quizzes 2次, Multiple choice questions, 睇晒Lecture notes都夠答, 20%
2. Canvas online discussion, 每個topic都打少少野上Canvas就Ok, 10%
3. Writing workshops, 主要係Attendance 同埋係Canvas 睇佢d Videos, 20%
4. Term essay, 最重要既一樣野, 切記要跟住First draft既Comment黎改, 仲有咩野疑問既就煩住個Instructor, 睇下佢地覺得你篇野仲有咩野可以改善, 50%(!!!)

FYI:
我第1次Quiz溫左, 第2次冇溫就咁考;
Online Discussion做足,
Tutorial既野做足, Canvas Online做足
Essay我出Grade之前有問過下佢, 佢話覺得我寫得幾好; 其實我First draft都係麻麻地, 跟住佢講個D野黎改, 所以切記要根據佢既Comment做啊!
最後都有A :)
reviews.comment_workload:
我覺得冇乜Workload咁濟, 雖然每個星期都有Online既野要係Canvas做, 不過i) For Workshop既, 可以撞冇限次, 我次次都冇睇就做, 個個都可以滿分, ii) For Discussion, 簡單討論下就可以, 唔洗次次都打到4,500字咁, 所以都係輕鬆既.

至於Workshop方面, 每次都係1個鐘左右, 每2星期一次, 上堂都係跟住佢做下D活動, 冇乜難度!

reviews.author: jlkl
reviews.comment_content: Some of the content are interesting and worth listening. But the length of lectures is a little bit long and most of the students are either falling asleep or watching youtube. The lectures are boring but it is alright to skip them, but there are will be PRS in the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: If you are confident with your English level, this would not be a difficult course for you.
reviews.comment_workload: Students are required to attend workshops in alternative weeks. The tutor will guide you throughout the essay writing process, so the essay is finished step by step.

reviews.author: djkim
reviews.title: Course Review
reviews.comment_content: Learning about philosophy and humanity related history
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor has failry minimal volume of voice, at first, you can barely hear the speaking if you sit at the back of the lecture room. However, you will realize his monotone teaching is relatively helps you to fall a sleep.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you finish following requirements at time you will at least have B
1. Course discussions
2. Essay
3. Canvas work assignment
4. Attendance in Writing workshops
reviews.comment_workload: It does not require students to do a lot of work in this class since most of the students are not even willing to come to the classroom.

reviews.comment_workload:

reviews.author: Rene
reviews.comment_content: Interesting topics revolving around life and philosophy
reviews.comment_teaching:
A really nice old man from Singapore
However his monotone teaching can definitely cure insomnia, so skipping class is a better option perhaps!
reviews.comment_grading:
50% of grade is based on essay, so as long as you write the essay really well, A- should not be a problem.

2 Quizzes is 20% in total and can be studied a day before the quiz.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only one essay and 2 MC quiz
TA will guide you through the essay writing, as long as your command of english is above average, easy peasy.

reviews.author: whoareyou
reviews.comment_content: Content is interesting. Self-studying is good enough. Except for quiz, I never attain any class after 2nd lesson.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is so-so. Professor's voice is way too low in lecture and I never hear a word.

Winnie is okay.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade! As long as you hand in everything on time and follow their timetable, you wont get a poor grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Pretty average. 2 quizzes, one essay(1000 words) with NO EXAM. I think it is worth spending time on the essay coz it count for 50% of the total grade.
Again, do submit everything on time coz otherwise there will be mark deduction.

reviews.author: ustgrad
reviews.title: HUMA 1000 review
reviews.comment_content: The content of HUMA 1000 L2 was quite okay. it wasn't too heavy or too illogical. The readings were acceptably interesting and that made the quizzes much more bearable.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lectures may be boring but we just attend to obtain IPRS attendance. The tutorials aren't many so it doesn't take up too much time. However, can afford to skip 2-3 lectures in the semester but no skipping of tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading: Attend most lectures and tutorials, you will secure your 20%. The quizzes are okay even if you read one day before the quiz. There are almost no other assessments and the essay should be written properly to ensure a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Minimal workload as compared to other courses in the business school.

reviews.author: USTian
reviews.comment_content:
Our lecture topic was "Righteousness, Destiny and Well-being". We learned about Utilitarianism, Kantianism, Confucianism and Mohism  for the first few weeks (topics for in-class quiz 1), and then Daoism, concept of Tian and Ming, righteousness and destiny in Mencius, self-establishment and detachment in Zhuangzi, and the life of a man of virtue in the last weeks (for in-class quiz 2). The first few weeks of contents was not too bad, but I found it hard to understand the latter topics.
Contents for the tutorial / writing workshops were fairly straightforward, and if you know how to write essays in English, you will not have much issues with it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Nam had poor teaching, and I barely went to any of the lectures. His PPTs were also badly organized so it was hard for me to study the course contents by myself.
Mr. William Lee had good English and teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 Online discussions - 10%
2 Lecture in-class quizzes - 20%
Writing workshop (tutorial) in-class activities - 10%
Writing workshop online activities - 10%
Final term essay - 50%
(3 Extra points for attendance in lectures - 3%)

I got 0.6 SD above mean (mean = 56.8%) on the first and 0.9 SD above mean (mean = 62%) on the second quiz, did 4 out of 5 weeks of writing workshop online activities, giving me a final score of B. I think you could aim for an A if you put just a bit of effort in it.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload itself is actually not too bad, but you just have to care about doing them.
Online discussions are based on current issues, and you need to incorporate materials learned in the lectures. Do comment on others' posts and "discuss".
For the in-class quizzes, there are one or two questions regarding the readings, and the others are mostly based on the lecture materials. Go through the PPTs before the quizzes, and you will at least be at the mean.
I don't think they really grade anything for the writing workshop in-class activities. You just have to show up.
The writing workshop online activities can be completed without having to refer to anything, because you can check the answers after submitting and then re-submit. They take your highest scores, so getting full marks there shouldn't be difficult, unless you forget to complete them before the deadline. You will also have to post your paragraphs, so just write something before the deadline and submit it on time.
Final term essay is not too bad, since you will be writing one paragraph each week for the writing workshops.

reviews.author: NOIUE

Topic is happiness, morality

2 piece of reading every week

can use as the source or give u some ideas towards yr essay

reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading
keep getting some easy marks and at least b range

Even yr eng is bad like i do, you can still get b range
prof focus on the structure rather than the wordings.
However, better eng must have advantage
reviews.comment_workload:
Keep attending tutorial only and hand in work on time
1 week 1 piece of assignment

20% quiz (easy)
10% online discussion (i think it is important) 5 in total but i only participate in 3 of them.
10% online workshop (few mc questions) (can retry as many as u can)(must get all of these 10 %)

actually workload is not too much.

又paper
又discussion

又present
又quiz

如果唔係ssc-h冇乜得揀,真係應該會drop
